Case reference: 2014001361.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2000, Emmanuel Emond was reported missing in Clair, New Brunswick. Emmanuel was last seen by his family on November 28, 1996. Emmanuel is believed to have gone to Mexico at a certain point.

Scar: Cheek, Scar between nose and mouth
Tattoo: Left Hand, X on top of left hand

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Berenice and Berangere Pare were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Berenice and Berangere, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014004048.CaseDesc: Dwayne Allen Rideout was last seen on September 24, 1999 at the Generator Cabaret on 3rd Avenue in Prince George, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2021030130.CaseDesc: On August 22, 2003, Gregory James was last seen in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2015020929.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2015, Andrzej Popek was last seen at the Crawford Lake Conservation Area in Milton, Ontario.  Andrzej's abandoned vehicle was located the following day in the Conservation's parking lot.

Case reference: 2014004496.CaseDesc: Peter Cortner was last seen on May 20, 2004. He was reported missing by his apartment manager where he resided in Downtown Vancouver. He had left all his belongings behind in his apartment suite and dissapeared without notice.

Case reference: 2005007599.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1986, a Caucasian male was found in the Niagara River, near the Whirlpool. He was estimated to be between 50-70 years old. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 127 lbs and his length was measured at 5’6”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had large earlobes. This male also had his appendix and was uncircumcised. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to a few weeks.

Hair: Bald, Believed to be bald, with a black beard.
Teeth: All of his teeth had been lost prior to death and it is unknown if he wore dentures.
Scar: Pelvis, Bilateral inguinal (groin area) scars, 9 cm
Abdomen, Midline scar on his abdomen (possibly from a hernia operation). 10.5 cm
Deformity: Left Shoulder, Large papilloma (benign non-cancerous tumor) on the back of his left shoulder.

Case reference: 2019055061.CaseDesc: Yannick Bastien went missing on September 21, 2019.  Yannick's vehicle and kayak were located at Lake Minnewanka, Alberta and he has not been located.

Case reference: 2006025099.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1988, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 40-74, was recovered from the Otonabee River, south of Lock 19 in Peterborough. There were stains on his teeth, which suggests that he was a smoker. The remains could have been in the water for a few weeks to many years.

Teeth: Stained, Although he was missing most of his molars, his upper left third molar was carious and could have caused him significant pain.

Case reference: 2006000299.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1989, an unidentified man collapsed on the sidewalk on Yonge Street, south of Front Street in Toronto, Ontario. The man was taken to St. Michael's Hospital, where he did not regain consciousness and subsequently died.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Dark, bushy eyebrows, several days growth of a beard
Scar: Evidence of previous brain surgery (right-sided craniotomy).

Case reference: 2015013522.CaseDesc: Richard St. Peter was in the process of moving residences. He was last heard from around Saturday March 14, 2015. It is not known where he may have gone, but he had vacated his last apartment and did not officially move into his new home.

Case reference: 2014026082.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2014, Francois Montcalm was seen for the last time when he left the family residence riding his vintage blue Peugeot Bicycle.

Case reference: 2014002160.CaseDesc: Jackelene Bylow was last seen at her residence on November 13, 1994 after having dinner at a restaurant near Willington Ave and Hastings St. She suffers from mental illness and addicted to drugs and alcohol.

Tattoo: Chest, Duck and blue bird on right breast

Case reference: 2018043199.CaseDesc: In December of 1995, Myung Lim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Myung and his wife had an argument and he told her he was returning to South Korea.

Case reference: 2012020062.CaseDesc: On July 15, 2000 Marcus McKay went hunting with his step father and three others.  Marcus and his step father broke apart from the group to hunt on their own. Some time later, the pair successfully felled a deer. Marcus was to stay with the deer while his step father went to get help from their friends. When his stepfather returned Marcus was no where to be found. He was last seen 10 km north of Mallard and Bison Road.

Case reference: 2010003899.CaseDesc: Pierre Mercon, age 21, a lifelong resident of Vaughan, Ontario, was last seen at approximately 2:00 A.M. on November 1st, 1996. He was observed leaving the "Original Six" Sports Bar, located on Oxford Street in the Town of Richmond Hill, where he had attended a Halloween Party and was last seen wearing a costume of Army fatigues, work boots, a green wool hat and a long black wig. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Back of right shoulder, tattoo of Uruguay

Case reference: 2006004699.CaseDesc: On 13 July 1992, William Aman left the shore of Lake Ontario to go fishing.  His boat was later found with his ball cap 3.2 kilometers off of Pete's Point, Lake Ontario. Mr. Aman has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014005390.CaseDesc: On November 10,  2009, Victoria Chan was seen for the last time in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Victoria was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014003128.CaseDesc: Olimpia Mikszan was last seen on the morning of June 21, 1996, outside her residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  She was living alone in a rental suite.  Her vehicle and nearly all of her personal belongings were left at her residence.  Olimpia had just completed high school.  Olimpia was born in Poland, speaks fluent Polish and has a slight Polish accent when speaking English.

Case reference: 2018005318.CaseDesc: In November 2016 Fereydoun Taleshpour Bandari left his apartment in the Carlton Street and Church Street area of Toronto, to travel.  It is believed Mr. Taleshpour Bandari was sick at the time he left his home.  All of his belongings were left in the apartment and his family cannot account for his whereabouts.

Hair: Black, Short, Straight, Black moustache and beard

Case reference: 2016068939.CaseDesc: A few days prior to April 3, 1968, the  remains of an adult male were found in a body of water. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140lbs and his length was measured at 5'5", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was believed to be in the water from a few weeks to a couple of months.

Hair: Grey, White, Hair was present at the temples
Teeth: Gold Visible, Upper and lower incisors had gold caps
Underwear: White boxer shorts with a red flowered pattern

Case reference: 2018052183.CaseDesc: In March 2017, the partial remains of a middle-aged male were found in the Skeena River near Terrace, British Columbia. The unidentified male had moderate arthritis in his lower back and is likely to have died many years before his remains were found.

Case reference: 2013000039.CaseDesc:
Darryl Ferneyhough went missing on the morning of Sunday, May 13, 2001. Darryl was seen at the
night club NRG on Gottingen Street at 1:30 a.m. and later seen at 3:40 a.m. running north on Gottingen Street in the area of the Marquee Club.

Case reference: 2014035917.CaseDesc: On October 14, 2014, Steven Hector Gravel was reported missing from North Bay, Ontario by his mother. Family members and friends have not seen nor heard from him since December 2000.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tattoo of a baby
Right Upper Arm , Stephanie, Lucky, winnie the pooh
Right Upper Arm , Heart, wings, sword

Case reference: 2006017899.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1973, John Begolo was last seen in Eganville, Ontario.  John indicated that he was planning to return to St. Catherine's, Ontario, by bus.  John has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Canadian Flag and Maple Leaf
Left Forearm, Nude woman entwined by snake

Case reference: 2012020089.CaseDesc: Michel Guy Favreau lived by himself in Nipawin, Saskatchewan and was in good physical health at the time of his disappearance. Mr. Favreau suffered from depression and was on medication for that illness. The last time anyone spoke to or saw Mr. Favreau was between September 22nd and September 25th, 2011. On October 4th, 2011 his vehicle, a 1998 green Chrysler Intrepid, was observed abandoned at Carrol's Cove camp ground near Nipawin. The vehicle was locked, the keys were in the ignition and Mr. Favreau's wallet was inside. Several searches including ground, water, and air, conducted in hopes of locating him were unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014006557.CaseDesc: Alvin Berg, 35 years old, was originally from the Pierceland District, SK. He was working as a farm labourer in the Spinney Hill district near Maymont, SK. Mr. Berg was last seen when he left this farm in October of 1940, after which he had no further contact with his family.

Case reference: 2005001499.CaseDesc: Lois was last seen shortly before midnight at the Village of Lucknow reunion dance on July 3, 1988. She left there and returned to her residence in Kincardine, Ontario where she resided alone. The police investigation indicates Lois was going through her usual evening routine before retiring. Lois, described as a devoted family person and a dedicated worker, failed to report for work on July 4, 1988. Her friends and family became concerned and notified police that she was missing.

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2014002565.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1975, Carl Gallen was employed as an iron worker on the Long Spruce dam project. He was working with his partner on a cement wall near the river. Mr. Gallen was drilling into the wall when he fell into the water. His partner indicated that Carl went directly under the water and that he did not see him surface. Mr. Gallen was not wearing either a safety belt or life jacket. It is presumed Mr. Gallen drowned.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014004485.CaseDesc: Pablo Guerra was reported missing by his family on May 10, 2004. He had no health issues. Pablo's jacket was located in a body of water under the Second Narrows Bridge by Vancouver City Police Marine Section the day Pablo was last seen.

Jacket: Black, North Face embroidered on left breast

Case reference: 2012020074.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1988 Cathy Williams left her residence in St. Andrews, Manitoba to go to Winnipeg to fill out a job application.  She had made arrangements to meet a male acquaintance who was going to help her complete the application.  During the late afternoon and early evening, Cathy and her friend attended two bars and eventually ended up at a restaurant.  Cathy left her friend at the restaurant.  From the restaurant, Cathy attended the residence of another male acquaintance who invited her in for a visit.  She indicated she had to get her purse from her friends car and she was going to be back in half an hour.  This was the last time Cathy Williams was seen.  Cathy was reported missing by her mother on the morning of August 23, 1988.  Cathy has not been heard from again and her body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2018063244.CaseDesc: On June 9, 2001, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Marilyn Payne was seen for the last time when she left the hostel she was staying at.

Case reference: 2012020096.CaseDesc: On September 17, 2008, Kevin Michel was with two other people at Usinne Lake, near Creighton, Saskatchewan, harvesting rice. Witnesses state Kevin walked away from their camp for reasons unknown. Extensive ground, air and water searches were conducted in the area but failed to locate Kevin.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Kevin heart bombers" (text) or "Kevin (heart symbol) bombers"

Case reference: 2014005064.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1983, Roy Nippi was last seen on the Chagoness/Kinistin First Nation near Tisdale, Saskatchewan. Roy was known to travel throughout western Canada and the western USA, however, searches and inquiries over the years with contacts in those provinces and states have failed to reveal any trace of Roy.

Case reference: 2015041172.CaseDesc: Helen Leyden was last heard from by her family sometime between 1968 and 1972. She was living in Edmonton, but is thought to have possibly gone to Vancouver during this time.

Case reference: 2021014455.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2018, Sonya Manning was seen for the last time in Buffalo, New York State. Sonya’s vehicle was located in close proximity to the falls in Niagara Falls. During the time of her disappearance, she was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Right Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Forehead, Turquoise jagged edges at hairline

Case reference: 2014004923.CaseDesc: On July 24th, 1973, Robert Chaple was reported missing. He was last seen arriving home on July 11th in the early morning hours.

Case reference: 2014004933.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1987, at approximately 7:00pm, Jimmy Hong was last seen by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. His friend indicated that Jimmy had left for Hamilton, Ontario, and would be returning the following Monday.

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006024599.CaseDesc: Chester Sawyers was last seen outside of a camp in Lochalsh (Riggs Township), Ontario on June 8, 1990.  It was reported that he was upset and indicated that he was heading home. It was believed that Mr. Sawyers left on foot and he has not been seen since.

Wallet: Brown, MasterCard, Canadian Tire Card, a driver's license

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2013000083.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1999, Jean-René Duguay was seen for the last time when he was seen jumping off the Lachapelle Bridge in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-René’s body was never found.

Case reference: 2006006499.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1972, Clifford Boyle was aboard the S.S. Gleneagle on which he was employed. He was last seen on the deck of the left side of the ship near the back.  It is presumed that Mr. Boyle fell overboard and is presumed drowned in Georgian Bay, Ontario.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, End of finger missing

Case reference: 2014001798.CaseDesc: On March 3, 1987, Nancy Dumas was reported missing. She was last seen by her daughter. Ms. Dumas had said that she was going to find her friends, and left her daughter's residence. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001392.CaseDesc: On March 31, 1994, Kuldip Singh was seen for the last time in Brampton, Ontario.  There is a possibility that Mr. Singh may be in the United States.

Case reference: 2008004499.CaseDesc: Paul Lanteigne was last seen on July 19, 1990. He telephoned his wife on July 20 to advise her he was leaving Cranberry Marina at 6:00 p.m. to return to the Dyconia Hotel in Wasaga Beach in his boat. The boat was recovered overturned in Georgian Bay, and a search was conducted. Grey deck shoes belonging to Mr. Lanteigne were found on the beach on July 21, 1990, but nothing else was recovered.

Case reference: 2014005111.CaseDesc: Chad Eirikson was reported missing by his mother. He left Vancouver, Canada to tour Central America in December, 1999.  In January, 2000, he called home requesting money a few times and received wire transfers from his mother to continue his trip. He has not been heard from since January 9, 2000.

Case reference: 2017029343.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2017, Patrick Wall was last seen at his home in Wetaskiwin County, Alberta. His abandoned vehicle was located in Edmonton, also in Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004478.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004, Norman Halkett was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Elbow, Transverse fracture across base of olecranon

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2012020010.CaseDesc: Jacek Laskowski was reported missing on May 3, 2005, from Calgary, AB.  Information suggests that he may have been last seen in the Golden, BC area.

Case reference: 2012020148.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from English Bay in Vancouver

Pants: Grey, Green, With a frog logo
Shoes: Leather, White, Grey, Made in Italy

Case reference: 2015045751.CaseDesc: On August 26, 2015 Lester Sampson was reported missing from Glen Vowell First Nation Village in B.C. This community is located on the west side of the Skeena River between Hazelton and Kispiox. Mr. Sampson’s brother last saw him at his residence in Glen Vowell on August 25, 2015.

Case reference: 2014004940.CaseDesc: On May 24, 2006, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Shemron King was seen for the last time by his father in Toronto, Ontario. When his father returned home, Shemrom and his mother were gone.

Case reference: 2013000140.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1981, Rene Laflamme was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. René had visited his mother in Ottawa, Ontario and had left her residence to travel back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2014004156.CaseDesc: On July 17,1975, Helen Jordan was last seen on a bench outside of 84 South Cumberland Street in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Prior to the time of her disappearance, Helen was known to frequent that area.

Case reference: 2007001599.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Robert St. Louis was seen for the last time when left his home in the Laval-Ouest district in Laval, Quebec. Robert left without his wallet and truck keys. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2016032179.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1944, Richard David was seen for the last time riding his bicycle in front of the family home while his brother was inside the house in Etobicoke, Ontario. Richard's bike was found at the house when his mother returned home that evening but Richard had vanished. He was a good child at home and in school, with no reason to run away.

Socks: Cotton, Grey, Yellow band at top

Case reference: 2014005164.CaseDesc: Anne Peters was reported missing in October 2008 after she had not been heard from for a month. Anne was a street trade worker and had a drug dependency.

Case reference: 2014005604.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2011, Dorothy Thomas was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Dorothy had not returned home for eighteen days.

Case reference: 2009002699.CaseDesc: Norman Welsh was on holidays with his mother and an incident occurred on July 18, 1976, which subsequently led him to the hospital. While in the hospital he was described as bitter and un-cooperative wanting to return home in St Catharines. While being escorted to the North Bay Pyschiatric Hospital (now Northeast Mental Health Centre), he ran off into the wooded area.

Teeth: Stained, Has a 2 tooth partial plate and is missing his front upper left tooth, teeth slightly stained
Scar: Head, Under the hair, due to an operation at the age of 16

Case reference: 2006003199.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2000, this Caucasian male, was witnessed to jump in front of a subway train at the Dundas Subway Station in Toronto. A "Playdium" card was found in his possession.

Hair: Brown, Short, baldness and reddish moustache
Teeth: Posts on upper middle incisors with crowns, fillings  in several molars
Shirt: White, Golf shirt with "Owen Sound Golf Classic '99" written on the front
Jacket: Grey, Sports jacket with "Tony Pass Oct 4/88" on the collar and "Habberlins" on the tag
Scar: Right Hand, possible burn scar on the back of the hand
Tattoo: Left Hand, unidentifiable, possibly a stick figure
Left Upper Arm, cross with dots
Right Forearm, heart with two arrows

Case reference: 2006018099.CaseDesc: On January 4, 1994, David Ernest Rowbotham was last seen in the Belleville/Trenton Ontario area.

Case reference: 2016061097.CaseDesc:
On June 18, 1979, the body of an unidentified male was found in the Detroit River near Riverside Drive and Crawford Avenue in the city of Windsor, Ontario. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. 
He is believed to have been in the water for 1 week to six months.

Hair: Black, Curly, Short, Moustache, possibly `Lamb Chop`style sideburns
Teeth: Unerupted wisdom teeth, which may have been impacted.

Case reference: 2014005291.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1990, at approximately 6:50am, Ann Lylyck was last seen by her friend when he dropped her and her dog off at the Our Lady of Mercy Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. Ann was intending on visiting her aunt, but wanted to walk her dog before going into the hospital. When her friend returned a few hours later, Ann could not be located.

Case reference: 2012020149.CaseDesc: These partial skeletal remains were recovered 11 km south of Highway #1 on Greenstone Road in the Dominic Lake area, approximately 22 km west of Kamloops.

Case reference: 2014005482.CaseDesc: Shaun Chris MacDonald-McLaughlin was reported missing on March 27, 2010 by his step-father. Shaun was last seen by his roommate on March 12, 2010, in Vancouver, British Columbia when he packed his belongings and stated he was going home. Shaun was known to have substance abuse problems and was diagnosed as a paranoid-schizophrenic.

Case reference: 2014005156.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2002, Jeanne Ouellette was seen for the last time at a Starbucks coffeehouse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020099.CaseDesc: Jack (Mike) St. Pierre was last seen on July 17, 2009, at approximately 1:00 p.m. He was on foot southbound from "the point" toward the hamlet of Wollaston Lake. Mr. St. Pierre may have been seen later taking a boat across the Bay at Wollaston Lake. Articles of clothing were located in the water near where he was last thought to have been seen.

Case reference: 2008005899.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1965, George Angeconeb left Red Lake on foot with plans to walk to Trout Lake.  He left during a severe snowstorm carrying a record player.  He was last seen at MacDowell Lake, First Nation Territory, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020041548.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2020, Horacio Calderon Alvidrez was last seen moving out from his residence in New Westminster, British Columbia. Horacio has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018038616.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2018, Cameron Richard Betker was reported missing by family.

Case reference: 2021056669.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2016, the remains of an unidentified man were recovered from Porcupine Strand, near Cartwright, Newfoundland. He may have been of Indigenous or Caucasian ancestry.

Case reference: 2014004389.CaseDesc: On October 23, 2003, Bertha Melvin, who was residing in a group home, left a note advising she was going to the hospital; however she failed to show up.  Ms. Melvin is described a being very introverted and may have been frequenting the rural areas of Waterways in Fort McMurray, AB.

Case reference: 2014004475.CaseDesc: On the morning of October 1, 1976, Crystal Van Huuksloot was seen for the last time with her suitcases in Toronto, Ontario. Crystal had traveled from Edmonton, Alberta to help raise funds for her boyfriend. She stayed in Toronto for one week, but did not board her return flight to Edmonton.

Case reference: 2006019399.CaseDesc: Randall Gunning was last seen on May 5, 1984, in the area of Elliot Lake. Mr. Gunning suffered from depression and was despondent when he left.

Case reference: 2014004725.CaseDesc: Jack Ford was last seen on September 20, 1991. His abandoned vehicle was located by hunters on a cut line near Cold Lake on September 21 or 28 of 1991. Mr. Ford was reported missing October 16, 1991 by his son.

Case reference: 2006023799.CaseDesc: On July 12, 1999, Jerzy Ryglewicz was last seen at a gas station in Merrickville. He has not been seen or made contact with any friends or family since.

Case reference: 2014003613.CaseDesc: Larry Mattis was last seen when he was taken to the Edmonton airport by a friend and dropped off for a flight to Toronto.

Case reference: 2009002599.CaseDesc: Mark Mayhew was residing with family at a residence in Sturgeon Falls. He left overnight without notice. There was no incident which upset him and caused him to leave. Mark was on foot, he had no vehicle and no known destination.

Teeth: False, No teeth; had false teeth but was not wearing them at the time.

Case reference: 2005001999.CaseDesc: In September 1979, Norman Ritchie, was a passenger in a 16 foot cedar strip boat on Georgian Bay near Cove Island, when it capsized. Five victims were recovered, but Mr. Ritchie has never been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020069.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1982, a Gimli resident reported that in 1972 Debbie Richardson arrived in Gimli to visit her brother.  According to this report, she stayed with him for approximately three months, then went missing. Debbie's brother last saw her in September, 1972, when he dropped her off on a highway so that she could hitchhike to Winnipeg.  She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005378.CaseDesc: On September 8, 2004, Robert Harrington was last seen near the intersection of Oakwood Avenue and Vaughan Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004904.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 5, 2007, Woon-Young Lee was seen for the last time at the West Park Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.  When nurses came to Woon-Young's room the next day, she was gone.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2014002519.CaseDesc: Mr. Beauchamps was last seen on April 18, 1977 in Montreal. Mr.Beauchamps went to his sister's house after an argument with his boyfriend. He stayed there for a few days, and then left without giving any more news.

Case reference: 2014005703.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1964, Harold Jackman was seen for the last time at his farm in Shillington, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Mr. Jackman wandered away from his farm.

Case reference: 2014001130.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1972, the body of a young man was found in the Fraser River near Port Coquitlam, British Columbia. The pathologist described him as being “short and chubby” and noted that he had had extensive dental work. It is believed that he died several weeks before his remains were recovered.

Case reference: 2012020024.CaseDesc: On February 24, 1995 what appeared to be a partial skull with an attached vertebra was located near a creek; just south of Highway 7, approximately 800 metres east of the Ruskin Bridge in Mission, B.C.  A DNA profile confirmed that this person was a female, and her DNA profile has been provided to every laboratory in Canada and shared with Interpol.  In August 2002, bones recovered during a search of a farm associated to Robert Pickton were confirmed to be genetically linked to this partial skull.  It is possible that this woman's family does not know that she is missing or may be under the mistaken belief that she was reported missing and there is a file open.

Case reference: 2017044551.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2017, at approximately 1:00pm, Mark Trizanto was last seen near Roncesvalles Avenue and the Queensway in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005571.CaseDesc: On March 18, 2011, Isabelle Roy-Roland left the Levis Hospital after receiving a permission to leave the grounds. She was never seen again.

Coat: Brown, 3/4 length coat with fur on the hood

Case reference: 2015065844.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2015, at approximately 2: 00am, David Howlett was seen for the last time in his home in Paradise, Newfoundland.  David’s car was later located in the area of Cape Spear in St. John’s, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2020017914.CaseDesc: In January of 1983, Helen King was seen for the last time at the Woodbine Community Centre in Toronto, Ontario where she had been a volunteer. Helen is known for living a transient lifestyle and has had no contact with family or friends since this time.

Case reference: 2018054233.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2018, Xinye Wang was last seen in China. Xinye was scheduled to return to Canada but has not been heard from or seen since.
